title: Abstract Wiki Frame: Article / document meta frame

frame_type.description: Canonical frame identifier for article/document meta frames.

subject.description: Optional main subject entity for the article, if there is a single clear topic (person, city, organization, etc.). Shape follows semantics.types.Entity.

title.description: Canonical article title in the source project (e.g. the page title on Wikipedia).

language.description: Language code of the article, typically ISO 639-1 (e.g. 'en', 'fr', 'sw').

project.description: Optional project identifier, e.g. 'wikipedia', 'wikivoyage', or another downstream consumer label.

page_id.description: Optional page identifier in the source system (e.g. MediaWiki page id).

revision_id.description: Optional revision identifier in the source system, if available.

sections.description: Ordered list of section-level meta frames describing the structure and scoped content of the article.

sources.description: List of source/citation meta frames used anywhere in the article-level semantics.

source_index.description: Optional mapping from source ids to source frames, for fast lookup. Keys are source_id strings; values are SourceCitationFrame objects.

extra.description: Arbitrary metadata bag for anything else that should travel with the article document frame but does not have a dedicated field (provenance, debug info, raw source snippets, etc.). Values should be JSON-serializable.
